lead_intro: Learn about the effects of fentanyl and why it can be dangerous in this informative video.

quiz.question: What neurotransmitter is released when fentanyl reaches the brain?
quiz.explanation: Fentanyl releases a flood of dopamine in the brain, contributing to feelings of euphoria.

quiz.question: Why can it be hard to take a safe dose of fentanyl?
choices: It is 50 times stronger than heroin
It is easily detectable in the body
quiz.answer: It is 50 times stronger than heroin
quiz.explanation: Fentanyl is up to 50 times stronger than heroin, making it easy to overdose on even small amounts.

quiz.question: What is a potential consequence of becoming dependent on fentanyl?
choices: Feeling joy only through the drug
quiz.answer: Feeling joy only through the drug
quiz.explanation: When dependent on fentanyl, individuals may find that the drug is the only source of joy in their lives.

quiz.question: In what year were there more fentanyl-related deaths than all US military deaths since the 60s?
quiz.explanation: In 2022, there were more fentanyl-related deaths than all US military deaths since the 1960s, highlighting the severity of the issue.

quiz.question: Why is fentanyl often mixed with other drugs?
quiz.explanation: Fentanyl is inexpensive to make, leading to its dangerous mixing with other drugs and increasing the risk of unintended consumption.
